verses.verse: O LORD, you are an avenging God;[b] shine forth, O God of vengeance.
Rise up, O judge of the earth; repay[c] the arrogant as they deserve.
O LORD, how long will the wicked, how long will the wicked be triumphant?[d]
[e]Their mouths pour forth their arrogant words as these evildoers never cease to boast.
They crush your people, O LORD, and they oppress your heritage.
They slay the widow and the foreigner and put the orphan to death.
They say, “The LORD does not see; the God of Jacob[f] pays no attention.”
[g]Try to comprehend, you senseless people. You fools, when will you gain some wisdom?[h]
Does the one who made the ear not hear? Does the one who fashioned the eye not see?[i]
Does the one who guides the nations[j] not punish? Does the one who instructs people lack knowledge?
The LORD is well aware of our thoughts[k] and how foolish they are.
[l]Blessed[m] is the man you admonish, O LORD, the man you teach by means of your law,
giving him respite in times of misfortune until a pit is dug for the wicked.
For the LORD will not abandon his people or forsake his heritage.[n]
Judgment will again be based on righteousness, and all the upright in heart[o] will uphold it.
[p]Who will stand up for me against the wicked? Who will defend me against evildoers?
If the LORD had not come to my aid, I would long ago have been consigned to the kingdom of silence.[q]
When I realized that my foot was slipping, your kindness,[r] O LORD, raised me up.
When my anxious thoughts multiplied, your comfort filled my soul with joy.[s]
[t]Can evil rulers have you as an ally, those who make use of the law to oppress the helpless?[u]
They conspire against the righteous[v] and condemn the innocent to death.
But the LORD has been my stronghold,[w] my God, the rock in whom I find refuge.
He will repay the wicked for their iniquity and destroy them for their evil deeds; the LORD, our God, will destroy them.
